overview:
Benjamin Joffe-Walt is a strategic communications and public relations specialist currently serving as head of communications at Change.org, the worldâ€™s largest petition platform.

He leads a global team of communications specialists presenting Change.org to a wide range of audiences. Prominent placements have included TIME, New York Times, Washington Post, Guardian, Bloomberg, Fortune, Businessweek, CNN, The Daily Show, Ellen, Diane Sawyer, Anderson Cooper, Dan Rather, and thousands of top tier mentions in more than 20 countries, from the Jakarta Globe and Times of India to El Pais and Le Parisien.

Prior to strategic communications Benjamin was a journalist and editor. His work appeared in academic journals and a wide variety of media, including the Economist, BBC, and New Statesman. He was named Young Journalist of the Year by the British Foreign Press Association in 2004 and awarded Africa Print Journalist of the Year by CNN the following year. He was also given a Society for Environmental Journalism award for a piece on electronic waste in China.

Benjamin served as a foreign correspondent for the Guardian, Chief Africa Correspondent for the Sunday Telegraph and as the editor of Colors, a multilingual international reportage magazine created by Tibor Kalman and Oliviero Toscani and sold in over 40 countries.
